column4: hi, i'm trying to use update manager to upgrade, previously i tried this but didn't have enough space to boot, now when i run update-manager and click upgrade it locks up - or at least hasn't been responding for hte past 20m
nah, the update manager has just frozen
Easiest way is "sudo apt-get remove compiz"
thanks... any idea if it is possible to disable it, not remove ?
There is also a gconf key for setting the default window manager.
